    • createUser

      public AbstractUser createUser(String name, String ID, int typeOfUser)
      This function creates a user object using a user factory based on the given name, ID, and type of user.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the user being created.
      ID - The ID parameter is a unique identifier for the user being created. It could be a string or a number that distinguishes one user from another.
      typeOfUser - The typeOfUser parameter is an integer value that represents the type of user being created. The specific values and their meanings would depend on the implementation of the UserFactory class.
      Returns:
      An instance of the AbstractUser class.

    • addUser

      public boolean addUser(AbstractUser user)
      This function adds a new user to a collection of users if the user's ID is not already present.
      Parameters:
      user - An object of type AbstractUser that represents a user to be added to a collection of users.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a boolean value, which indicates whether the user was successfully added to the collection or not. If the user was added, the method returns true. If the user was not added (because a user with the same ID already exists in the collection), the method returns false.

    • showUserInfo

      public String showUserInfo(String ID)
      The function returns a string representation of a user's information based on their ID.
      Parameters:
      ID - The ID parameter is a String representing the unique identifier of a user in a collection or database of users. The method retrieves the user information associated with the given ID and returns it as a String.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a string representation of the user information associated with the given ID. The exact format and content of the string will depend on the implementation of the `toString()` method for the user object.

    • createBibliographicProduct

      public BibliographicProduct createBibliographicProduct(String name, int numberOfPages, Calendar pubicationDate, String URL, double value, String extraArgument, int category_genre, int typeOfProduct)
      This function creates a bibliographic product based on the type of product specified and returns it.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the bibliographic product being created.
      numberOfPages - an integer representing the number of pages in the bibliographic product.
      pubicationDate - A Calendar object representing the publication date of the bibliographic product.
      URL - A string representing the URL of the bibliographic product.
      value - The value parameter is a double data type that represents the monetary value of the bibliographic product.
      extraArgument - The "extraArgument" parameter is a String that can be used to pass any additional information or arguments that may be required by the specific implementation of the BibliographicProduct. It is not used in the provided code snippet, but it can be used to provide additional details or customization options for the created product
      category_genre - an integer representing the category or genre of the bibliographic product being created.
      typeOfProduct - An integer value representing the type of bibliographic product to be created. A value of 1 represents a book, and a value of 2 represents a magazine.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a BibliographicProduct object.

    • addProduct

      public String addProduct(BibliographicProduct product)
      The function adds a bibliographic product to a list of products, ensuring that the product ID is unique.
      Parameters:
      product - an object of type BibliographicProduct, which is a superclass for Book and Magazine classes. It contains information about a product such as its ID, title, author, publisher, and publication date.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String, which is the ID of the BibliographicProduct that was added to the products list.

    • showProductInfoById

      public String showProductInfoById(String ID)
      The function returns product information based on the input ID, or "This item does not exist" if the ID is not found.
      Parameters:
      ID - The ID parameter is a String that represents the unique identifier of a product.
      Returns:
      The method `showProductInfoById` returns a string that contains either the information of the product with the given ID or the message "This item does not exist" if the product is not found.

    • showProductInfoByName

      public String showProductInfoByName(String name)
      The function searches for a product by name and returns its information if found, otherwise it returns a message indicating that the item does not exist.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the product that the user wants to retrieve information for.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String that contains either the information of the product with the given name or the message "This item does not exist" if there is no product with that name in the list.

    • showProductsWithSimilarName

      public String showProductsWithSimilarName(String productsName)
      This Java function returns a string containing the names and IDs of products whose names contain a given string.
      Parameters:
      productsName - A String representing the name of the product(s) to search for. The method will return a list of products whose names contain the specified string, regardless of case sensitivity.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String containing the names and IDs of all products whose name contains the input string (case-insensitive).

    • deleteProduct

      public String deleteProduct(String ID)
      This function deletes a product from a list and removes it from all users' lists if it exists.
      Parameters:
      ID - ID is a String parameter that represents the unique identifier of a product that needs to be deleted from the system.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a message as a String. The message will be "We could not find this product" if the product with the given ID is not found, and "Product deleted" if the product is successfully deleted.

    • findProductByID

      public int findProductByID(String ID)
      This function searches for a product in a list by its ID and returns its position.
      Parameters:
      ID - The ID parameter is a String that represents the unique identifier of a product. The method searches for a product in a list of products by comparing the ID of each product with the given ID parameter. If a product with the same ID is found, the method returns the index position of that product in the
      Returns:
      The method is returning an integer value which represents the position of the product in the list of products with the given ID. If the product is not found, the method returns -1.

    • showProductLabeledAttributes

      public String showProductLabeledAttributes(String ID)
      The function returns labeled attributes of a bibliographic product identified by its ID, depending on whether it is a book or a magazine.
      Parameters:
      ID - The ID parameter is a String that represents the unique identifier of a bibliographic product.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a string containing the labeled attributes of a product with the given ID. If the product is a book, it will return the labeled attributes of a book. If the product is a magazine, it will return the labeled attributes of a magazine. If the product is not found, an empty string will be returned.

    • displayInformationByProduct

      public String displayInformationByProduct(String ID, int option)
      The function displays the product information based on the product ID and option selected. This methods is used to make it easier for the user to select the information they want to change.
      Parameters:
      ID - A string representing the ID of a bibliographic product.
      option - an integer representing the user's selected option for displaying information about a product.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String variable named "info".

    • changeProduct

      public String changeProduct(String productID, int option, String newValue)
      This function changes the properties of a product based on the option selected and returns a message indicating the success or failure of the change.
      Parameters:
      productID - A String representing the ID of the product to be changed.
      option - An integer representing the option selected by the user to change a specific attribute of a product. The options are:
      newValue - The new value that will replace the current value of the selected product attribute.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String message indicating the result of the product change operation. The message can be one of the following: "We could not find this product", "Product name changed", "Product number of pages changed", "Product publication date changed", "Product URL changed", "Product value changed", "Product genre changed", or "Product category changed".

    • checkOutShoppingCart

      public String checkOutShoppingCart(String userID)
      This function checks out the shopping cart of a user with a given userID. It will empty all the products added into the car The method is user to let the user buy multiple products at once.
      Parameters:
      userID - The userID parameter is a String that represents the unique identifier of a user in the system. It is used to retrieve the user object from the users map and call the checkOutShoppingCart method on it.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String. If the user does not exist, it returns "The user does not exist". Otherwise, it calls the checkOutShoppingCart() method of the user object and returns the result.

    • addProductToUser

      public String addProductToUser(String userID, String productID)
      This function adds a product to a user's cart and checks for various conditions before doing so.
      Parameters:
      userID - A String representing the ID of the user to whom the product is being added.
      productID - The unique identifier of the product being added to the user's cart.
      Returns:
      The method may return one of the following strings: - "Either the user or the product ID was not found" - "The user has already 5 books" - "The user is already subscribed to 2 magazines" - "This user already has this product" - A message returned by the user's addProductToCar method. If the transaccion was completted.

    • unsubscribeMagazine

      public String unsubscribeMagazine(String userID, String magazineID)
      The function unsubscribes a user from a magazine and updates the copies sold count if the user and magazine ID are found.
      Parameters:
      userID - A string representing the ID of the user who wants to unsubscribe from a magazine.
      magazineID - The ID of the magazine that the user wants to unsubscribe from.
      Returns:
      The method returns a String message indicating whether the user was successfully unsubscribed from the magazine or if either the user or the magazine ID was not found.

    • productsOfAUser

      public String productsOfAUser(String userID)
      This function returns the products of a user if the user exists, otherwise it returns a message stating that the user does not exist.
      Parameters:
      userID - The userID parameter is a String that represents the unique identifier of a user in the system. It is used to retrieve information about the user's products.
      Returns:
      The method `productsOfAUser` returns a string containing information about the products of a user with the given `userID`. If the user does not exist, the method returns the string "The user does not exist".

    • magazinesOfAUser

      public String magazinesOfAUser(String userID)
      This function returns the magazines of a user if the user exists, otherwise it returns a message indicating that the user does not exist.
      Parameters:
      userID - The userID parameter is a String that represents the unique identifier of a user in the system. It is used to retrieve information about the magazines that a user has subscribed to.
      Returns:
      The method `magazinesOfAUser` is being called on an `AbstractUser` object corresponding to the `userID` passed as parameter. If the user exists, the method returns a string containing information about the magazines subscribed by the user. If the user does not exist, the method returns the string "The user does not exist". The final returned value depends on whether the user exists or not

    • startAReagindSession

      public String startAReagindSession(String productID, char option, String userID)
      The function allows a user to start a reading session for a specific book, with options to navigate through pages and return to the library.
      Parameters:
      productID - A string representing the ID of the product (book) being read.
      option - The option selected by the user, which can be 'a', 'A', 's', 'S', 'B', or 'b'.
      userID - The ID of the user who is starting a reading session.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String that represents the current reading session of a user for a specific book. The String includes information about the book being read, the current page being read, and options for the user to navigate through the book or go back to the library.

    • startMatrixReadingSession

      public String startMatrixReadingSession(String option, String userID)
      This function starts a reading session for a user in their library matrix and allows them to navigate through the pages.
      Parameters:
      option - A string representing the user's selected option for the matrix reading session. It can be "A" to go to the previous page, "S" to go to the next page, or "E" to exit the session.
      userID - A string representing the unique identifier of the user who wants to start a matrix reading session.
      Returns:
      The method returns a String that represents the reading matrix and options for a reading session. The reading matrix includes the name of the user's library and the current page of the library. The options include instructions to insert the Y/X coordinate or the product's code to start a reading session, and to press A to go to the previous page, S to go to the next page, or E to exit

    • searchProduct

      public BibliographicProduct searchProduct(String userID, String word)
      The function searches for a bibliographic product based on a user ID and a search term, either by ID or by coordinate.
      Parameters:
      userID - A string representing the ID of the user who is searching for a bibliographic product.
      word - The search term used to find a bibliographic product. It can either be a product ID or a coordinate in the user's library.
      Returns:
      The method `searchProduct` returns a `BibliographicProduct` object.

    • showPublicity

      public String showPublicity(int currentPage, AbstractUser user)
      The function returns a random advertisement message based on the current page and if the user is Standar.
      Parameters:
      currentPage - an integer representing the current page being viewed by the user
      user - An instance of the AbstractUser class, which is a parent class for different types of users in a system. The specific type of user is not specified in this method.
      Returns:
      The method returns a string that represents a random advertisement message from an array of three possible messages. The message is only returned if the current page number is a multiple of 5 and the user is an instance of the Standard class. If these conditions are not met, an empty string is returned.

    • amountOfPagesByProduct

      public String amountOfPagesByProduct()
      This function calculates the total number of pages read by books and magazines in a list of products.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String message that displays the total number of pages read by books and magazines in the products list.

    • genreAndCategoryWithTheMostAmountOfPagesRead

      public String genreAndCategoryWithTheMostAmountOfPagesRead()
      This function returns the genre and category with the most amount of pages read.
      Returns:
      A string that includes the genre with the most amount of pages read and the category with the most amount of pages read.

    • top5BooksAndTop5MagazinesRead

      public String top5BooksAndTop5MagazinesRead()
      The function returns a string containing the top 5 books and top 5 magazines read, sorted by the number of pages read.
      Returns:
      The method `top5BooksAndTop5MagazinesRead()` is returning a string that contains the top 5 books and top 5 magazines read. The string is constructed by calling the `top5books()` and `top5magazines()` methods and concatenating the results with some additional text.

    • sortBibliographicProductsByPagesRead

      public void sortBibliographicProductsByPagesRead(ArrayList<BibliographicProduct> products)
      This function sorts an ArrayList of BibliographicProduct objects by the number of pages read in each product.
      Parameters:
      products - an ArrayList of BibliographicProduct objects that need to be sorted based on the number of pages read. The method uses a lambda expression to compare the number of pages read for each product and sort them in ascending order.

    • top5books

      public String top5books()
      The function returns the top 5 books from a list of products sorted by name and ID.
      Returns:
      The method `top5books()` returns a string containing the names and IDs of the top 5 books in the `products` list.

    • top5magazines

      public String top5magazines()
      The function returns the top 5 magazines from a list of products sorted by name and ID.
      Returns:
      The method `top5magazines()` returns a string containing the names and IDs of the top 5 magazines in the `products` list.

    • salesByGenre

      public String salesByGenre()
      The function calculates and returns the total sales and number of books sold for each genre (science fiction, fantasy, and historical novel) in a list of bibliographic products.
      Returns:
      The method `salesByGenre()` returns a string that shows the total amount of sales and the number of books sold for each genre (Science Fiction, Fantasy, and Historical Novel) in the `products` list.

    • salesByCategory

      public String salesByCategory()
      The function calculates and returns the total sales and amount of magazines sold in three different categories.
      Returns:
      The method `salesByCategory()` returns a string that shows the total number of sales and the total value of sales for each category of magazines: VARIETIES, DESIGN, and SCIENTIFIC.
